newsArray.title: England vs North Macedonia: Euro 2024 qualifier prediction, team news, kick-off time, TV, live stream, odds
creator: Matt Verri
newsArray.description: Englandâ€™s stars look to go into the summer on a high as they face North Macedonia at Wembley in the final game of the season.
newsArray.content: â€™s stars look to go into the summer on a high as they face North Macedonia at in the final game of the season. â€™s side eased to victory over Malta last time out to make it three wins from three in qualifying, and their spot in next summerâ€™s tournament in Germany already looks to be effectively secured. North Macedonia need a swift response after their disappointment on Friday â€” they led Ukraine by two goals at half-time but fell apart in the second-half to lose 3-2. England vs North Macedonia is scheduled for a 7.45pm BST kick-off on Monday, June 19, 2023. The match will take place at Wembley Stadium in London. In the UK, the game will be televised live and free-to-air on Channel 4, with coverage starting at 7pm BST. Fans can also catch the contest live for free online via the All4 website and app. You can follow all the action on matchday via Standard Sportâ€™s live blog, with expert analysis from Dan Kilpatrick at the ground. Bukayo Saka was withdrawn at half-time in the win over Malta after picking up a knock, and despite Southgate insisting that substitution was only precautionary. Phil Foden came off the bench in that match and could start at Wembley, with his Man City team-mates Kyle Walker, Jack Grealish, John Stones and Kalvin Phillips all pushing to be involved too. Eberechi Eze should get more minutes after making his debut last time out, while Southgate may opt to continue with in midfield after his superb display. No10: Trent Alexander-Arnold shone in a more advanced role North Macedonia should offer a sterner test than Malta, but England will still be confident of a comfortable win on home soil. With the likely return of Englandâ€™s Man City contingent and the Three Lions so often cruising to big victories in these qualifying games, Southgateâ€™s side could rack up the goals again. England wins: 2 Draws: 2 North Macedonia wins: 0 England to win - 1/10 Draw - 15/2 North Macedonia to win - 25/1

newsArray.description: England are set to recall a host of Manchester City players against North Macedonia.
newsArray.content: are set to recall a host of players against North Macedonia. City players did not start Fridayâ€™s 4-0 win in after playing in the Champions League Final. But is likely return to partner , while and are to set play some part against North Macedonia at Old Trafford. has trained ahead of the game and Gareth Southgate has confirmed the Arsenal winger is fit despite taking a heavy knock to his ankle against Malta. Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is pushing to start in what is the first England game at Old Trafford since 2007. Trent Alexander-Arnold will likely continue in midfield ahead of Kalvin Phillips or Conor Gallagher after his man-of-the match display in Malta. West Ham captain Declan Rice is also pushing to start. Pickford; Trippier, Stones, Maguire, Shaw; Alexander-Arnold, Henderson, Rice; Foden, Kane, Rashford.

newsArray.title: Man Utd takeover news: Private update on Sheikh Jassim talks as Erik ten Hag 'furious'
newsArray.description: Manchester United takeover LIVE: Express Sport provides all the latest updates as Sheikh Jassim closes in on a Glazer agreement.
newsArray.content: Despite the radio silence surrounding the club's takeover, Sheikh Jassim bin Hamad Al Thani could be making progress in his efforts to buy Manchester United from the Glazer family. A new update regarding the ongoings behind-the-scenes at Old Trafford provides hope that the end could be near. Frustration among fans, staff, and likely players and Erik ten Hag, too, is rife amid a lack of clarity about United's future. Seven months after the Glazers announced they were considering investment options, including a sale, their mouths have been zipped. But there is a sense that Sheikh Jassim has crept ahead of Sir Jim Ratcliffe in his hopes of completing a Qatari takeover in M16. And while updates are far and few, reports are suggesting that he is in the driver's seat as the saga crawls to a conclusion. Express Sport provides all the latest news and views around the Manchester United takeover. Follow LIVE updates...

newsArray.title: Luke Shaw names â€˜world classâ€™ England duo heâ€™d love to sign for Manchester United after Carrington â€˜tourâ€™
creator: Nizaar Kinsella
newsArray.description: Three Lions star opens up on how transfer market is a big topic of conversation in camp
newsArray.content: has admitted that he would love to sign â€œworld classâ€ international teammates and for . The 27-year-old cheekily posted pictures with Kane and Rice on social media stating that he took them on a â€œtourâ€ of Carrington, where are preparing to face North Macedonia on Monday. Kane is a known target of the Red Devils but currently looks unlikely to leave this summer. United, meanwhile, have been tipped for a move for Rice but he continues to look -bound. They are just two players in Gareth Southgateâ€™s squad who could move clubs this summer, not including Mason Mount, who United are continuing to pursue. Speaking about his clubâ€™s transfer plans, Shaw explained that he would like Englandâ€™s best to join him at Old Trafford: â€œYes, [my Instagram post was] half joking. It is a bit of both. SPONSORED â€œI know they are both world-class players and I donâ€™t know what is going on at their clubs but if it was down to me, I would take them in a heartbeat and they would improve our team massively and help us go to what we want to achieve. â€œThey have been here the last couple of days and hopefully they like it and can get used to it! It is up to the club and whatever they decide so we have to go from there.â€ This England squad features as many as ten players facing uncertain futures at their clubs this summer. Jordan Pickford, Marc Guehi, Harry Maguire, Kyle Walker, Kalvin Phillips, Conor Gallagher and James Maddison are also being linked with moves. Shaw accepted that it is a major talking point among the squad, who have become increasingly close-knit. He added: â€œIt is hard not to read because it is everywhere. â€œBecause of the situation of when this camp is and the situation of contracts running down, there is much more talk this time around than there has been in other years. â€œWe read what is going on. We all talk. We are all really close. We have private conversations of what is going on although they wonâ€™t be spoken about here. We speak and that is all I can say.â€ Declan Rice and Harry Kane are both targets for Man Utd England have won their first three matches to reach Euro 2024 and are considered among the favourites to win the tournament in Germany. After seeing Jude Bellingham join Real Madrid for Â£100million, Shaw thinks Englandâ€™s stars are rightly coveted after reaching new levels. He said: â€œYou could pick anyone in this squad and love them to come to your team. We have strength and depth. â€œWorld-class abilities and any players that leave to go to another club this summer will only make the other team better. â€œIâ€™ll do anything I can to bring the right players [to United] that I know the manager will like and want and who will improve our team. Itâ€™s only a matter of time until weâ€™re challenging for the big trophies.â€

newsArray.title: Ireland boss Stephen Kenny insists he has not sought assurances over his future
creator: BreakingNews.ie
newsArray.description: Ireland have lost five of their last eight competitive matches.
newsArray.content: Stephen Kenny has insisted he has not sought assurances over his future as Republic of Ireland manager despite facing mounting criticism. Kennyâ€™s position has been questioned and potential successors touted in the wake of a hugely disappointing 2-1 Euro 2024 qualifying defeat in Greece on Friday evening which left Irelandâ€™s hopes of making it to the finals in severe jeopardy after just two games. However, asked if he had been given any assurances by the Football Association of Ireland that he would see out the campaign, the 51-year-old replied: â€œI havenâ€™t sought any assurance. Thatâ€™s not something I do.â€ Kenny, who complained about â€œa lack of respectâ€ at his pre-match press conference, was asked how he felt he was doing as Ireland manager. Stephen Kenny has not sought assurances over his future (Brian Lawless/PA) He said: â€œIâ€™m not going to sit here and do a full press conference on an assessment of my period in charge or anything like that, Iâ€™m here really to prepare for tomorrow, the game against Gibraltar. Advertisement â€œItâ€™s a big game for us. Obviously, Iâ€™m disappointed that we lost against Greece, but weâ€™ve got to bounce back against Gibraltar and Iâ€™m fairly sure we can do that, and weâ€™ll take that into September.â€ For all Kennyâ€™s bullishness, Ireland have won only four of the 23 competitive games they have played under his charge and lost five of the last eight. Asked if that was a source of disappointment, he said: â€œItâ€™s a fair question. Iâ€™m disappointed about the Greek game, Iâ€™m disappointed we didnâ€™t get the result that we needed. Listen, we have lost a game that we wanted to win and we have to bounce back against Gibraltar.â€ Former Ireland boss Brian Kerr was critical of Kennyâ€™s tenure in his role as a TV pundit, while counterpart Liam Brady, one of the nationâ€™s most gifted former internationals, described the current squad as â€œthe worst group of players that any manager has had in my lifetimeâ€. Ireland manager Stephen Kenny confirms James McClean will receive his 100th cap tomorrow against Gibraltar and will captain the team to mark his incredible achievement ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª Our Jimmy ğŸ’š pic.twitter.com/Jup5TLlwzV Advertisement â€” Ireland Football âš½ï¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª (@IrelandFootball) June 18, 2023 James McClean, who will captain the side against Gibraltar on Monday as he collects his 100th cap, said: â€œIt would be very stupid and naive for me to sit here and take on Liam Brady and criticise Liam Brady with the calibre of player that he was and what he was. Iâ€™m not going to do that. â€œBut look, we have a tendency, especially in this country, to get carried away. We are two games in now. This country in the past has shown that we have big results in us when no-one has expected it. â€œThere is a lot of football to be played between now and the end of the campaign. Weâ€™re not naive, we know itâ€™s going to be tough, very tough, but we have to start somewhere and we aim to do that on Monday night against Gibraltar and take it a game at a time.â€ X

newsArray.title: Croatia 0-0 Spain (4-5 pens): Luka Modric denied remarkable trophy win after penalty shootout drama
creator: Marc Mayo
newsArray.description: La Roja win Nations League final after coming through mighty test in Rotterdam
newsArray.content: were crowned champions of the 2023 UEFA Nations League after Unai Simonâ€™s heroics in Sundayâ€™s penalty shootout, after a drab 0-0 draw over 120 minutes. Chasing their first-ever major trophy and possibly a last dance for and a team that has finished second and third at the last two World Cups, failed to pull off their trademark route to tournament glory of simply outlasting their opponent in a match of pure attrition. Lovro Majer and Bruno Petkovic both saw their penalties saved by goalkeeper Simon and, although spurned Spainâ€™s first match point, stepped up to seal La Rojaâ€™s first triumph in the competition. After the drama of both semi-finals and the five-goal play-off that Italy won earlier in the day to take third place, it was perhaps not surprising that it was the final that delivered a more tense affair. In truth, it was a game that had penalties written all over it from very early on. SPONSORED Both teams reeled out the classics; Croatia doggedly organised and sensibly biding their time without any concern at going the distance, Spain most at ease when calmly passing the ball with maximum patience as they looked to craft an immaculate breakthrough goal. A slow start was punctured by Croatian goalkeeper Dominik Livakovic dropping a straightforward cross onto his post, before the offside Alvaro Morata failed to pounce on the rebound. Another mistake from Zlatko Dalicâ€™s side handed Gavi an opportunity to shoot from 18 yards, an effort he dragged wide, before Aymeric Laporte did superbly to deny Andrej Kramaric a shooting chance with a break up the other end. In the second half, it wasnâ€™t until the latter stages that La Roja looked the most likely side to grab the go-ahead goal. Ansu Fatiâ€™s pace terrorised Croatiaâ€™s defenders after he came off the bench and fine work from Jordi Alba helped tee up the Barcelona youngster with five minutes left, only for his stab goalwards to be turned off the line by Ivan Perisic. Extra time saw Dani Olmo fire over the bar from a central position as Spain continued to waste decent chances in front of goal. Croatiaâ€™s shootout defeat leaves a question mark over Modricâ€™s international future, although it will hardly be a surprise if he opts for a final shot at glory in next summerâ€™s Euros - when heâ€™ll be 38 and coming off the back of likely his last season at Real Madrid. For Spain, Luis de la Fuente has come through a rocky start to life in the dugout with a perhaps surprising piece of silverware as they kickstart a new era in fine fashion.

newsArray.title: Transfer news LIVE! Arsenal set for Havertz discount, Rice update; Chelsea near triple deal; Spurs latest
creator: Alex Young
newsArray.description: Follow all the latest summer transfer news, rumours and gossip right here
newsArray.content: LIVE! The is now open and , and are all busy on deals. The Gunners have seen an opening bid for rejected, , and Chelsea forward has reportedly agreed personal terms over a move that could cost as little as Â£60million. The Blues, meanwhile, have agreed personal terms with Villarreal forward Nicolas Jackson and are also working on signing a new midfielder. Brighton star wants and Conor Gallagher could leave in a player-plus-cash deal. Chelsea have ended their interest in Inter Milan goalkeeper Andre Onana, with now in pole position. Over at Tottenham, Leicester duo James Maddison and Harvey Barnes are top targets, while for around Â£25m. United have given up on bringing Harry Kane to Old Trafford, while they also look set to miss out on Kim Min-jae as Bayern Munich close in on signing the centre-back. Follow all the latest news, gossip and rumours below! Goncalo Ramos is available for Â£80m this summer. Agent Jorge Mendes has reportedly offered the Benfica striker around Europe with a very clear price tag on his head. Among the teams tracking Ramosâ€™ situation are Manchester United, Tottenham, West Ham and Newcastle, so say The Sun. Emile Smith Rowe has vowed to fight for his Arsenal career after rumours of a move away. Mikel Arteta wants to keep the midfielder at the Emirates next season despite interest from Brighton. â€œArsenal are my club and Iâ€™m not going to give up until [Arteta] says he doesnâ€™t want me,â€ he told The Times. â€œBut thatâ€™s not the case. He wants me as part of the team and I want to fight for my place and get back in the team.â€ Leicester want a speedy resolution to the speculation over James Maddisonâ€™s future. Newcastle and Tottenham are both unwilling to meet the Foxesâ€™ price tag, according to Northern Echo. Maddison will cost Â£60m even though his contract expires in a yearâ€™s time. Romelu Lukaku has told Chelsea he only wants to sign for Inter Milan. The Nerazzurri have seen a loan bid for the Belgian striker rejected after he spent this season on a temporary deal back at the Giuseppe Meazza. Inter also want Kalidou Koulibaly on loan next year. However, Chelsea have rejected the bids as they look to seal a permanent sale. La Gazzetta dello Sport report on Lukaku being determined to re-sign for Inter. Mikel Arteta has declined Alexis Sanchezâ€™s offer to return to Arsenal. Chilean newspaper La Tercera claim the ex-Gunners winger called Arteta after his contract expired at Marseille. But a reportedly â€œdirectâ€ response from the manager was not a positive one for 34-year-old Sanchez. Kylian Mbappe has once again spoken of his plans to snub a move to Real Madrid this summer. With only a year left on his PSG contract, the Frenchman told Telefoot that he is calm over his future. â€œI have already said that I will stay at Paris Saint-Germain Germain and I said it before all this happened,â€ he stated. â€œNext year I'll play for PSG, that's what I said. There are many things that can happen in a year, especially in a club like PSG.â€ Kylian Mbappe addresses the French media ahead of Euro 2024 qualifiers against Gibraltar and Greece Inter Milan have been warned not to sell Nicolo Barella to Chelsea. Newcastle are also keen on the Italian midfielder, and a sale would be greeted with fury by Interâ€™s ultras. They have posted a group message to social media making clear their anger at any potential exit, writing of Barella: â€œInterista born, present and future. Untouchable.â€ Arsenal are ready to cash in on Thomas Partey. With Granit Xhaka set to leave for Bayer Leverkusen and Mikel Arteta eyeing new midfielders, the Ghanaian may be next to head for pastures new. The Telegraph report on Arsenal being ready to listen to offers if a replacement can be found. Declan Rice and Romeo Lavia are both sought after by the Gunners. Erik ten Hag is reportedly furious that Manchester Unitedâ€™s takeover has held up his transfer plans. The Glazers continue to dither over whether to sell the club to Jim Ratcliffe or Sheikh Jassim, with a solution not expected until after the start of next season. United are said by The Sun to have wanted Declan Rice, but now look set to miss out on him to Arsenal or Manchester City. Kyle Walker is in talks to sign for Bayern Munich. Having been left out of Manchester Cityâ€™s line-up for the Champions League final, the England defender is ready to try his luck elsewhere. Sky Germany say no agreement has been reached between Bayern, Walker and City yet but Thomas Tuchelâ€™s presence in Bavaria is helping to persuade him to join.

newsArray.title: England vs North Macedonia: Euro 2024 qualifier prediction, team news, kick-off time, TV, live stream, odds
creator: Matt Verri
newsArray.description: Englandâ€™s stars look to go into the summer on a high as they face North Macedonia at Wembley in the final game of the season.
newsArray.content: â€™s stars look to go into the summer on a high as they face North Macedonia at in the final game of the season. â€™s side eased to victory over Malta last time out to make it three wins from three in qualifying, and their spot in next summerâ€™s tournament in Germany already looks to be effectively secured. North Macedonia need a swift response after their disappointment on Friday â€” they led Ukraine by two goals at half-time but fell apart in the second-half to lose 3-2. England vs North Macedonia is scheduled for a 7.45pm BST kick-off on Monday, June 19, 2023. The match will take place at Wembley Stadium in London. In the UK, the game will be televised live and free-to-air on Channel 4, with coverage starting at 7pm BST. Fans can also catch the contest live for free online via the All4 website and app. You can follow all the action on matchday via Standard Sportâ€™s live blog, with expert analysis from Dan Kilpatrick at the ground. Bukayo Saka was withdrawn at half-time in the win over Malta after picking up a knock, and despite Southgate insisting that substitution was only precautionary. Phil Foden came off the bench in that match and could start at Wembley, with his Man City team-mates Kyle Walker, Jack Grealish, John Stones and Kalvin Phillips all pushing to be involved too. Eberechi Eze should get more minutes after making his debut last time out, while Southgate may opt to continue with in midfield after his superb display. No10: Trent Alexander-Arnold shone in a more advanced role North Macedonia should offer a sterner test than Malta, but England will still be confident of a comfortable win on home soil. With the likely return of Englandâ€™s Man City contingent and the Three Lions so often cruising to big victories in these qualifying games, Southgateâ€™s side could rack up the goals again. England wins: 2 Draws: 2 North Macedonia wins: 0 England to win - 1/10 Draw - 15/2 North Macedonia to win - 25/1

newsArray.description: England are set to recall a host of Manchester City players against North Macedonia.
newsArray.content: are set to recall a host of players against North Macedonia. City players did not start Fridayâ€™s 4-0 win in after playing in the Champions League Final. But is likely return to partner , while and are to set play some part against North Macedonia at Old Trafford. has trained ahead of the game and Gareth Southgate has confirmed the Arsenal winger is fit despite taking a heavy knock to his ankle against Malta. Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is pushing to start in what is the first England game at Old Trafford since 2007. Trent Alexander-Arnold will likely continue in midfield ahead of Kalvin Phillips or Conor Gallagher after his man-of-the match display in Malta. West Ham captain Declan Rice is also pushing to start. Pickford; Trippier, Stones, Maguire, Shaw; Alexander-Arnold, Henderson, Rice; Foden, Kane, Rashford.

newsArray.title: Man Utd takeover news: Private update on Sheikh Jassim talks as Erik ten Hag 'furious'
newsArray.description: Manchester United takeover LIVE: Express Sport provides all the latest updates as Sheikh Jassim closes in on a Glazer agreement.
newsArray.content: Despite the radio silence surrounding the club's takeover, Sheikh Jassim bin Hamad Al Thani could be making progress in his efforts to buy Manchester United from the Glazer family. A new update regarding the ongoings behind-the-scenes at Old Trafford provides hope that the end could be near. Frustration among fans, staff, and likely players and Erik ten Hag, too, is rife amid a lack of clarity about United's future. Seven months after the Glazers announced they were considering investment options, including a sale, their mouths have been zipped. But there is a sense that Sheikh Jassim has crept ahead of Sir Jim Ratcliffe in his hopes of completing a Qatari takeover in M16. And while updates are far and few, reports are suggesting that he is in the driver's seat as the saga crawls to a conclusion. Express Sport provides all the latest news and views around the Manchester United takeover. Follow LIVE updates...

newsArray.title: Luke Shaw names â€˜world classâ€™ England duo heâ€™d love to sign for Manchester United after Carrington â€˜tourâ€™
creator: Nizaar Kinsella
newsArray.description: Three Lions star opens up on how transfer market is a big topic of conversation in camp
newsArray.content: has admitted that he would love to sign â€œworld classâ€ international teammates and for . The 27-year-old cheekily posted pictures with Kane and Rice on social media stating that he took them on a â€œtourâ€ of Carrington, where are preparing to face North Macedonia on Monday. Kane is a known target of the Red Devils but currently looks unlikely to leave this summer. United, meanwhile, have been tipped for a move for Rice but he continues to look -bound. They are just two players in Gareth Southgateâ€™s squad who could move clubs this summer, not including Mason Mount, who United are continuing to pursue. Speaking about his clubâ€™s transfer plans, Shaw explained that he would like Englandâ€™s best to join him at Old Trafford: â€œYes, [my Instagram post was] half joking. It is a bit of both. SPONSORED â€œI know they are both world-class players and I donâ€™t know what is going on at their clubs but if it was down to me, I would take them in a heartbeat and they would improve our team massively and help us go to what we want to achieve. â€œThey have been here the last couple of days and hopefully they like it and can get used to it! It is up to the club and whatever they decide so we have to go from there.â€ This England squad features as many as ten players facing uncertain futures at their clubs this summer. Jordan Pickford, Marc Guehi, Harry Maguire, Kyle Walker, Kalvin Phillips, Conor Gallagher and James Maddison are also being linked with moves. Shaw accepted that it is a major talking point among the squad, who have become increasingly close-knit. He added: â€œIt is hard not to read because it is everywhere. â€œBecause of the situation of when this camp is and the situation of contracts running down, there is much more talk this time around than there has been in other years. â€œWe read what is going on. We all talk. We are all really close. We have private conversations of what is going on although they wonâ€™t be spoken about here. We speak and that is all I can say.â€ Declan Rice and Harry Kane are both targets for Man Utd England have won their first three matches to reach Euro 2024 and are considered among the favourites to win the tournament in Germany. After seeing Jude Bellingham join Real Madrid for Â£100million, Shaw thinks Englandâ€™s stars are rightly coveted after reaching new levels. He said: â€œYou could pick anyone in this squad and love them to come to your team. We have strength and depth. â€œWorld-class abilities and any players that leave to go to another club this summer will only make the other team better. â€œIâ€™ll do anything I can to bring the right players [to United] that I know the manager will like and want and who will improve our team. Itâ€™s only a matter of time until weâ€™re challenging for the big trophies.â€

newsArray.title: Ireland boss Stephen Kenny insists he has not sought assurances over his future
creator: BreakingNews.ie
newsArray.description: Ireland have lost five of their last eight competitive matches.
newsArray.content: Stephen Kenny has insisted he has not sought assurances over his future as Republic of Ireland manager despite facing mounting criticism. Kennyâ€™s position has been questioned and potential successors touted in the wake of a hugely disappointing 2-1 Euro 2024 qualifying defeat in Greece on Friday evening which left Irelandâ€™s hopes of making it to the finals in severe jeopardy after just two games. However, asked if he had been given any assurances by the Football Association of Ireland that he would see out the campaign, the 51-year-old replied: â€œI havenâ€™t sought any assurance. Thatâ€™s not something I do.â€ Kenny, who complained about â€œa lack of respectâ€ at his pre-match press conference, was asked how he felt he was doing as Ireland manager. Stephen Kenny has not sought assurances over his future (Brian Lawless/PA) He said: â€œIâ€™m not going to sit here and do a full press conference on an assessment of my period in charge or anything like that, Iâ€™m here really to prepare for tomorrow, the game against Gibraltar. Advertisement â€œItâ€™s a big game for us. Obviously, Iâ€™m disappointed that we lost against Greece, but weâ€™ve got to bounce back against Gibraltar and Iâ€™m fairly sure we can do that, and weâ€™ll take that into September.â€ For all Kennyâ€™s bullishness, Ireland have won only four of the 23 competitive games they have played under his charge and lost five of the last eight. Asked if that was a source of disappointment, he said: â€œItâ€™s a fair question. Iâ€™m disappointed about the Greek game, Iâ€™m disappointed we didnâ€™t get the result that we needed. Listen, we have lost a game that we wanted to win and we have to bounce back against Gibraltar.â€ Former Ireland boss Brian Kerr was critical of Kennyâ€™s tenure in his role as a TV pundit, while counterpart Liam Brady, one of the nationâ€™s most gifted former internationals, described the current squad as â€œthe worst group of players that any manager has had in my lifetimeâ€. Ireland manager Stephen Kenny confirms James McClean will receive his 100th cap tomorrow against Gibraltar and will captain the team to mark his incredible achievement ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª Our Jimmy ğŸ’š pic.twitter.com/Jup5TLlwzV Advertisement â€” Ireland Football âš½ï¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª (@IrelandFootball) June 18, 2023 James McClean, who will captain the side against Gibraltar on Monday as he collects his 100th cap, said: â€œIt would be very stupid and naive for me to sit here and take on Liam Brady and criticise Liam Brady with the calibre of player that he was and what he was. Iâ€™m not going to do that. â€œBut look, we have a tendency, especially in this country, to get carried away. We are two games in now. This country in the past has shown that we have big results in us when no-one has expected it. â€œThere is a lot of football to be played between now and the end of the campaign. Weâ€™re not naive, we know itâ€™s going to be tough, very tough, but we have to start somewhere and we aim to do that on Monday night against Gibraltar and take it a game at a time.â€ X

newsArray.title: Croatia 0-0 Spain (4-5 pens): Luka Modric denied remarkable trophy win after penalty shootout drama
creator: Marc Mayo
newsArray.description: La Roja win Nations League final after coming through mighty test in Rotterdam
newsArray.content: were crowned champions of the 2023 UEFA Nations League after Unai Simonâ€™s heroics in Sundayâ€™s penalty shootout, after a drab 0-0 draw over 120 minutes. Chasing their first-ever major trophy and possibly a last dance for and a team that has finished second and third at the last two World Cups, failed to pull off their trademark route to tournament glory of simply outlasting their opponent in a match of pure attrition. Lovro Majer and Bruno Petkovic both saw their penalties saved by goalkeeper Simon and, although spurned Spainâ€™s first match point, stepped up to seal La Rojaâ€™s first triumph in the competition. After the drama of both semi-finals and the five-goal play-off that Italy won earlier in the day to take third place, it was perhaps not surprising that it was the final that delivered a more tense affair. In truth, it was a game that had penalties written all over it from very early on. SPONSORED Both teams reeled out the classics; Croatia doggedly organised and sensibly biding their time without any concern at going the distance, Spain most at ease when calmly passing the ball with maximum patience as they looked to craft an immaculate breakthrough goal. A slow start was punctured by Croatian goalkeeper Dominik Livakovic dropping a straightforward cross onto his post, before the offside Alvaro Morata failed to pounce on the rebound. Another mistake from Zlatko Dalicâ€™s side handed Gavi an opportunity to shoot from 18 yards, an effort he dragged wide, before Aymeric Laporte did superbly to deny Andrej Kramaric a shooting chance with a break up the other end. In the second half, it wasnâ€™t until the latter stages that La Roja looked the most likely side to grab the go-ahead goal. Ansu Fatiâ€™s pace terrorised Croatiaâ€™s defenders after he came off the bench and fine work from Jordi Alba helped tee up the Barcelona youngster with five minutes left, only for his stab goalwards to be turned off the line by Ivan Perisic. Extra time saw Dani Olmo fire over the bar from a central position as Spain continued to waste decent chances in front of goal. Croatiaâ€™s shootout defeat leaves a question mark over Modricâ€™s international future, although it will hardly be a surprise if he opts for a final shot at glory in next summerâ€™s Euros - when heâ€™ll be 38 and coming off the back of likely his last season at Real Madrid. For Spain, Luis de la Fuente has come through a rocky start to life in the dugout with a perhaps surprising piece of silverware as they kickstart a new era in fine fashion.

newsArray.title: Transfer news LIVE! Arsenal set for Havertz discount, Rice update; Chelsea near triple deal; Spurs latest
creator: Alex Young
newsArray.description: Follow all the latest summer transfer news, rumours and gossip right here
newsArray.content: LIVE! The is now open and , and are all busy on deals. The Gunners have seen an opening bid for rejected, , and Chelsea forward has reportedly agreed personal terms over a move that could cost as little as Â£60million. The Blues, meanwhile, have agreed personal terms with Villarreal forward Nicolas Jackson and are also working on signing a new midfielder. Brighton star wants and Conor Gallagher could leave in a player-plus-cash deal. Chelsea have ended their interest in Inter Milan goalkeeper Andre Onana, with now in pole position. Over at Tottenham, Leicester duo James Maddison and Harvey Barnes are top targets, while for around Â£25m. United have given up on bringing Harry Kane to Old Trafford, while they also look set to miss out on Kim Min-jae as Bayern Munich close in on signing the centre-back. Follow all the latest news, gossip and rumours below! Goncalo Ramos is available for Â£80m this summer. Agent Jorge Mendes has reportedly offered the Benfica striker around Europe with a very clear price tag on his head. Among the teams tracking Ramosâ€™ situation are Manchester United, Tottenham, West Ham and Newcastle, so say The Sun. Emile Smith Rowe has vowed to fight for his Arsenal career after rumours of a move away. Mikel Arteta wants to keep the midfielder at the Emirates next season despite interest from Brighton. â€œArsenal are my club and Iâ€™m not going to give up until [Arteta] says he doesnâ€™t want me,â€ he told The Times. â€œBut thatâ€™s not the case. He wants me as part of the team and I want to fight for my place and get back in the team.â€ Leicester want a speedy resolution to the speculation over James Maddisonâ€™s future. Newcastle and Tottenham are both unwilling to meet the Foxesâ€™ price tag, according to Northern Echo. Maddison will cost Â£60m even though his contract expires in a yearâ€™s time. Romelu Lukaku has told Chelsea he only wants to sign for Inter Milan. The Nerazzurri have seen a loan bid for the Belgian striker rejected after he spent this season on a temporary deal back at the Giuseppe Meazza. Inter also want Kalidou Koulibaly on loan next year. However, Chelsea have rejected the bids as they look to seal a permanent sale. La Gazzetta dello Sport report on Lukaku being determined to re-sign for Inter. Mikel Arteta has declined Alexis Sanchezâ€™s offer to return to Arsenal. Chilean newspaper La Tercera claim the ex-Gunners winger called Arteta after his contract expired at Marseille. But a reportedly â€œdirectâ€ response from the manager was not a positive one for 34-year-old Sanchez. Kylian Mbappe has once again spoken of his plans to snub a move to Real Madrid this summer. With only a year left on his PSG contract, the Frenchman told Telefoot that he is calm over his future. â€œI have already said that I will stay at Paris Saint-Germain Germain and I said it before all this happened,â€ he stated. â€œNext year I'll play for PSG, that's what I said. There are many things that can happen in a year, especially in a club like PSG.â€ Kylian Mbappe addresses the French media ahead of Euro 2024 qualifiers against Gibraltar and Greece Inter Milan have been warned not to sell Nicolo Barella to Chelsea. Newcastle are also keen on the Italian midfielder, and a sale would be greeted with fury by Interâ€™s ultras. They have posted a group message to social media making clear their anger at any potential exit, writing of Barella: â€œInterista born, present and future. Untouchable.â€ Arsenal are ready to cash in on Thomas Partey. With Granit Xhaka set to leave for Bayer Leverkusen and Mikel Arteta eyeing new midfielders, the Ghanaian may be next to head for pastures new. The Telegraph report on Arsenal being ready to listen to offers if a replacement can be found. Declan Rice and Romeo Lavia are both sought after by the Gunners. Erik ten Hag is reportedly furious that Manchester Unitedâ€™s takeover has held up his transfer plans. The Glazers continue to dither over whether to sell the club to Jim Ratcliffe or Sheikh Jassim, with a solution not expected until after the start of next season. United are said by The Sun to have wanted Declan Rice, but now look set to miss out on him to Arsenal or Manchester City. Kyle Walker is in talks to sign for Bayern Munich. Having been left out of Manchester Cityâ€™s line-up for the Champions League final, the England defender is ready to try his luck elsewhere. Sky Germany say no agreement has been reached between Bayern, Walker and City yet but Thomas Tuchelâ€™s presence in Bavaria is helping to persuade him to join.

newsArray.title: England vs North Macedonia: Euro 2024 qualifier prediction, team news, kick-off time, TV, live stream, odds
creator: Matt Verri
newsArray.description: Englandâ€™s stars look to go into the summer on a high as they face North Macedonia at Wembley in the final game of the season.
newsArray.content: â€™s stars look to go into the summer on a high as they face North Macedonia at in the final game of the season. â€™s side eased to victory over Malta last time out to make it three wins from three in qualifying, and their spot in next summerâ€™s tournament in Germany already looks to be effectively secured. North Macedonia need a swift response after their disappointment on Friday â€” they led Ukraine by two goals at half-time but fell apart in the second-half to lose 3-2. England vs North Macedonia is scheduled for a 7.45pm BST kick-off on Monday, June 19, 2023. The match will take place at Wembley Stadium in London. In the UK, the game will be televised live and free-to-air on Channel 4, with coverage starting at 7pm BST. Fans can also catch the contest live for free online via the All4 website and app. You can follow all the action on matchday via Standard Sportâ€™s live blog, with expert analysis from Dan Kilpatrick at the ground. Bukayo Saka was withdrawn at half-time in the win over Malta after picking up a knock, and despite Southgate insisting that substitution was only precautionary. Phil Foden came off the bench in that match and could start at Wembley, with his Man City team-mates Kyle Walker, Jack Grealish, John Stones and Kalvin Phillips all pushing to be involved too. Eberechi Eze should get more minutes after making his debut last time out, while Southgate may opt to continue with in midfield after his superb display. No10: Trent Alexander-Arnold shone in a more advanced role North Macedonia should offer a sterner test than Malta, but England will still be confident of a comfortable win on home soil. With the likely return of Englandâ€™s Man City contingent and the Three Lions so often cruising to big victories in these qualifying games, Southgateâ€™s side could rack up the goals again. England wins: 2 Draws: 2 North Macedonia wins: 0 England to win - 1/10 Draw - 15/2 North Macedonia to win - 25/1

newsArray.description: England are set to recall a host of Manchester City players against North Macedonia.
newsArray.content: are set to recall a host of players against North Macedonia. City players did not start Fridayâ€™s 4-0 win in after playing in the Champions League Final. But is likely return to partner , while and are to set play some part against North Macedonia at Old Trafford. has trained ahead of the game and Gareth Southgate has confirmed the Arsenal winger is fit despite taking a heavy knock to his ankle against Malta. Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford is pushing to start in what is the first England game at Old Trafford since 2007. Trent Alexander-Arnold will likely continue in midfield ahead of Kalvin Phillips or Conor Gallagher after his man-of-the match display in Malta. West Ham captain Declan Rice is also pushing to start. Pickford; Trippier, Stones, Maguire, Shaw; Alexander-Arnold, Henderson, Rice; Foden, Kane, Rashford.

newsArray.title: Man Utd takeover news: Private update on Sheikh Jassim talks as Erik ten Hag 'furious'
newsArray.description: Manchester United takeover LIVE: Express Sport provides all the latest updates as Sheikh Jassim closes in on a Glazer agreement.
newsArray.content: Despite the radio silence surrounding the club's takeover, Sheikh Jassim bin Hamad Al Thani could be making progress in his efforts to buy Manchester United from the Glazer family. A new update regarding the ongoings behind-the-scenes at Old Trafford provides hope that the end could be near. Frustration among fans, staff, and likely players and Erik ten Hag, too, is rife amid a lack of clarity about United's future. Seven months after the Glazers announced they were considering investment options, including a sale, their mouths have been zipped. But there is a sense that Sheikh Jassim has crept ahead of Sir Jim Ratcliffe in his hopes of completing a Qatari takeover in M16. And while updates are far and few, reports are suggesting that he is in the driver's seat as the saga crawls to a conclusion. Express Sport provides all the latest news and views around the Manchester United takeover. Follow LIVE updates...

newsArray.title: Luke Shaw names â€˜world classâ€™ England duo heâ€™d love to sign for Manchester United after Carrington â€˜tourâ€™
creator: Nizaar Kinsella
newsArray.description: Three Lions star opens up on how transfer market is a big topic of conversation in camp
newsArray.content: has admitted that he would love to sign â€œworld classâ€ international teammates and for . The 27-year-old cheekily posted pictures with Kane and Rice on social media stating that he took them on a â€œtourâ€ of Carrington, where are preparing to face North Macedonia on Monday. Kane is a known target of the Red Devils but currently looks unlikely to leave this summer. United, meanwhile, have been tipped for a move for Rice but he continues to look -bound. They are just two players in Gareth Southgateâ€™s squad who could move clubs this summer, not including Mason Mount, who United are continuing to pursue. Speaking about his clubâ€™s transfer plans, Shaw explained that he would like Englandâ€™s best to join him at Old Trafford: â€œYes, [my Instagram post was] half joking. It is a bit of both. SPONSORED â€œI know they are both world-class players and I donâ€™t know what is going on at their clubs but if it was down to me, I would take them in a heartbeat and they would improve our team massively and help us go to what we want to achieve. â€œThey have been here the last couple of days and hopefully they like it and can get used to it! It is up to the club and whatever they decide so we have to go from there.â€ This England squad features as many as ten players facing uncertain futures at their clubs this summer. Jordan Pickford, Marc Guehi, Harry Maguire, Kyle Walker, Kalvin Phillips, Conor Gallagher and James Maddison are also being linked with moves. Shaw accepted that it is a major talking point among the squad, who have become increasingly close-knit. He added: â€œIt is hard not to read because it is everywhere. â€œBecause of the situation of when this camp is and the situation of contracts running down, there is much more talk this time around than there has been in other years. â€œWe read what is going on. We all talk. We are all really close. We have private conversations of what is going on although they wonâ€™t be spoken about here. We speak and that is all I can say.â€ Declan Rice and Harry Kane are both targets for Man Utd England have won their first three matches to reach Euro 2024 and are considered among the favourites to win the tournament in Germany. After seeing Jude Bellingham join Real Madrid for Â£100million, Shaw thinks Englandâ€™s stars are rightly coveted after reaching new levels. He said: â€œYou could pick anyone in this squad and love them to come to your team. We have strength and depth. â€œWorld-class abilities and any players that leave to go to another club this summer will only make the other team better. â€œIâ€™ll do anything I can to bring the right players [to United] that I know the manager will like and want and who will improve our team. Itâ€™s only a matter of time until weâ€™re challenging for the big trophies.â€

newsArray.title: Ireland boss Stephen Kenny insists he has not sought assurances over his future
creator: BreakingNews.ie
newsArray.description: Ireland have lost five of their last eight competitive matches.
newsArray.content: Stephen Kenny has insisted he has not sought assurances over his future as Republic of Ireland manager despite facing mounting criticism. Kennyâ€™s position has been questioned and potential successors touted in the wake of a hugely disappointing 2-1 Euro 2024 qualifying defeat in Greece on Friday evening which left Irelandâ€™s hopes of making it to the finals in severe jeopardy after just two games. However, asked if he had been given any assurances by the Football Association of Ireland that he would see out the campaign, the 51-year-old replied: â€œI havenâ€™t sought any assurance. Thatâ€™s not something I do.â€ Kenny, who complained about â€œa lack of respectâ€ at his pre-match press conference, was asked how he felt he was doing as Ireland manager. Stephen Kenny has not sought assurances over his future (Brian Lawless/PA) He said: â€œIâ€™m not going to sit here and do a full press conference on an assessment of my period in charge or anything like that, Iâ€™m here really to prepare for tomorrow, the game against Gibraltar. Advertisement â€œItâ€™s a big game for us. Obviously, Iâ€™m disappointed that we lost against Greece, but weâ€™ve got to bounce back against Gibraltar and Iâ€™m fairly sure we can do that, and weâ€™ll take that into September.â€ For all Kennyâ€™s bullishness, Ireland have won only four of the 23 competitive games they have played under his charge and lost five of the last eight. Asked if that was a source of disappointment, he said: â€œItâ€™s a fair question. Iâ€™m disappointed about the Greek game, Iâ€™m disappointed we didnâ€™t get the result that we needed. Listen, we have lost a game that we wanted to win and we have to bounce back against Gibraltar.â€ Former Ireland boss Brian Kerr was critical of Kennyâ€™s tenure in his role as a TV pundit, while counterpart Liam Brady, one of the nationâ€™s most gifted former internationals, described the current squad as â€œthe worst group of players that any manager has had in my lifetimeâ€. Ireland manager Stephen Kenny confirms James McClean will receive his 100th cap tomorrow against Gibraltar and will captain the team to mark his incredible achievement ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª Our Jimmy ğŸ’š pic.twitter.com/Jup5TLlwzV Advertisement â€” Ireland Football âš½ï¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡ª (@IrelandFootball) June 18, 2023 James McClean, who will captain the side against Gibraltar on Monday as he collects his 100th cap, said: â€œIt would be very stupid and naive for me to sit here and take on Liam Brady and criticise Liam Brady with the calibre of player that he was and what he was. Iâ€™m not going to do that. â€œBut look, we have a tendency, especially in this country, to get carried away. We are two games in now. This country in the past has shown that we have big results in us when no-one has expected it. â€œThere is a lot of football to be played between now and the end of the campaign. Weâ€™re not naive, we know itâ€™s going to be tough, very tough, but we have to start somewhere and we aim to do that on Monday night against Gibraltar and take it a game at a time.â€ X

newsArray.title: Croatia 0-0 Spain (4-5 pens): Luka Modric denied remarkable trophy win after penalty shootout drama
creator: Marc Mayo
newsArray.description: La Roja win Nations League final after coming through mighty test in Rotterdam
newsArray.content: were crowned champions of the 2023 UEFA Nations League after Unai Simonâ€™s heroics in Sundayâ€™s penalty shootout, after a drab 0-0 draw over 120 minutes. Chasing their first-ever major trophy and possibly a last dance for and a team that has finished second and third at the last two World Cups, failed to pull off their trademark route to tournament glory of simply outlasting their opponent in a match of pure attrition. Lovro Majer and Bruno Petkovic both saw their penalties saved by goalkeeper Simon and, although spurned Spainâ€™s first match point, stepped up to seal La Rojaâ€™s first triumph in the competition. After the drama of both semi-finals and the five-goal play-off that Italy won earlier in the day to take third place, it was perhaps not surprising that it was the final that delivered a more tense affair. In truth, it was a game that had penalties written all over it from very early on. SPONSORED Both teams reeled out the classics; Croatia doggedly organised and sensibly biding their time without any concern at going the distance, Spain most at ease when calmly passing the ball with maximum patience as they looked to craft an immaculate breakthrough goal. A slow start was punctured by Croatian goalkeeper Dominik Livakovic dropping a straightforward cross onto his post, before the offside Alvaro Morata failed to pounce on the rebound. Another mistake from Zlatko Dalicâ€™s side handed Gavi an opportunity to shoot from 18 yards, an effort he dragged wide, before Aymeric Laporte did superbly to deny Andrej Kramaric a shooting chance with a break up the other end. In the second half, it wasnâ€™t until the latter stages that La Roja looked the most likely side to grab the go-ahead goal. Ansu Fatiâ€™s pace terrorised Croatiaâ€™s defenders after he came off the bench and fine work from Jordi Alba helped tee up the Barcelona youngster with five minutes left, only for his stab goalwards to be turned off the line by Ivan Perisic. Extra time saw Dani Olmo fire over the bar from a central position as Spain continued to waste decent chances in front of goal. Croatiaâ€™s shootout defeat leaves a question mark over Modricâ€™s international future, although it will hardly be a surprise if he opts for a final shot at glory in next summerâ€™s Euros - when heâ€™ll be 38 and coming off the back of likely his last season at Real Madrid. For Spain, Luis de la Fuente has come through a rocky start to life in the dugout with a perhaps surprising piece of silverware as they kickstart a new era in fine fashion.

newsArray.title: Transfer news LIVE! Arsenal set for Havertz discount, Rice update; Chelsea near triple deal; Spurs latest
creator: Alex Young
newsArray.description: Follow all the latest summer transfer news, rumours and gossip right here
newsArray.content: LIVE! The is now open and , and are all busy on deals. The Gunners have seen an opening bid for rejected, , and Chelsea forward has reportedly agreed personal terms over a move that could cost as little as Â£60million. The Blues, meanwhile, have agreed personal terms with Villarreal forward Nicolas Jackson and are also working on signing a new midfielder. Brighton star wants and Conor Gallagher could leave in a player-plus-cash deal. Chelsea have ended their interest in Inter Milan goalkeeper Andre Onana, with now in pole position. Over at Tottenham, Leicester duo James Maddison and Harvey Barnes are top targets, while for around Â£25m. United have given up on bringing Harry Kane to Old Trafford, while they also look set to miss out on Kim Min-jae as Bayern Munich close in on signing the centre-back. Follow all the latest news, gossip and rumours below! Goncalo Ramos is available for Â£80m this summer. Agent Jorge Mendes has reportedly offered the Benfica striker around Europe with a very clear price tag on his head. Among the teams tracking Ramosâ€™ situation are Manchester United, Tottenham, West Ham and Newcastle, so say The Sun. Emile Smith Rowe has vowed to fight for his Arsenal career after rumours of a move away. Mikel Arteta wants to keep the midfielder at the Emirates next season despite interest from Brighton. â€œArsenal are my club and Iâ€™m not going to give up until [Arteta] says he doesnâ€™t want me,â€ he told The Times. â€œBut thatâ€™s not the case. He wants me as part of the team and I want to fight for my place and get back in the team.â€ Leicester want a speedy resolution to the speculation over James Maddisonâ€™s future. Newcastle and Tottenham are both unwilling to meet the Foxesâ€™ price tag, according to Northern Echo. Maddison will cost Â£60m even though his contract expires in a yearâ€™s time. Romelu Lukaku has told Chelsea he only wants to sign for Inter Milan. The Nerazzurri have seen a loan bid for the Belgian striker rejected after he spent this season on a temporary deal back at the Giuseppe Meazza. Inter also want Kalidou Koulibaly on loan next year. However, Chelsea have rejected the bids as they look to seal a permanent sale. La Gazzetta dello Sport report on Lukaku being determined to re-sign for Inter. Mikel Arteta has declined Alexis Sanchezâ€™s offer to return to Arsenal. Chilean newspaper La Tercera claim the ex-Gunners winger called Arteta after his contract expired at Marseille. But a reportedly â€œdirectâ€ response from the manager was not a positive one for 34-year-old Sanchez. Kylian Mbappe has once again spoken of his plans to snub a move to Real Madrid this summer. With only a year left on his PSG contract, the Frenchman told Telefoot that he is calm over his future. â€œI have already said that I will stay at Paris Saint-Germain Germain and I said it before all this happened,â€ he stated. â€œNext year I'll play for PSG, that's what I said. There are many things that can happen in a year, especially in a club like PSG.â€ Kylian Mbappe addresses the French media ahead of Euro 2024 qualifiers against Gibraltar and Greece Inter Milan have been warned not to sell Nicolo Barella to Chelsea. Newcastle are also keen on the Italian midfielder, and a sale would be greeted with fury by Interâ€™s ultras. They have posted a group message to social media making clear their anger at any potential exit, writing of Barella: â€œInterista born, present and future. Untouchable.â€ Arsenal are ready to cash in on Thomas Partey. With Granit Xhaka set to leave for Bayer Leverkusen and Mikel Arteta eyeing new midfielders, the Ghanaian may be next to head for pastures new. The Telegraph report on Arsenal being ready to listen to offers if a replacement can be found. Declan Rice and Romeo Lavia are both sought after by the Gunners. Erik ten Hag is reportedly furious that Manchester Unitedâ€™s takeover has held up his transfer plans. The Glazers continue to dither over whether to sell the club to Jim Ratcliffe or Sheikh Jassim, with a solution not expected until after the start of next season. United are said by The Sun to have wanted Declan Rice, but now look set to miss out on him to Arsenal or Manchester City. Kyle Walker is in talks to sign for Bayern Munich. Having been left out of Manchester Cityâ€™s line-up for the Champions League final, the England defender is ready to try his luck elsewhere. Sky Germany say no agreement has been reached between Bayern, Walker and City yet but Thomas Tuchelâ€™s presence in Bavaria is helping to persuade him to join.
